column4: I have an application that i want to be able to run as normal user, not having to do it as root; how can i do this?
what's the application?
puredata
an app for realtime audio and video sinthesis; i know it works as normal user cos i have it in other computer
how did you install it?
it was a .deb package
and you have to su to use it?
: first sudo -i
then pd
where is pd installed?
/usr/local
do you know about unix permissions?
a bit
i have a suspicion you may need to change either pd's permissions or its ownership. In a shell, navigate to the directory where pd resides and do an ls -l on it, see what it says.
i solved it
what file did you need to rename?
it was called .pdsettings, i needed to rename it so the program wouldnt find it
I didn't bother erasing mine. I just clobbered it.
clobbered?
yes, I simply umounted it and did an mkfs on it.
the thing theres a bunch of gigabytes i kept there i now want for linux
you might want to move all that stuff temporarily to another drive while you clobber. I'm not aware of any way to convert an ntfs volume to ext3 without losing everything.
i wouldnt bother losing everything, theres nothing there, actually
i installed ubuntu when the computer was new
